docs.snippet: A former N.B.A. player, now a league executive, asserts that two years of pre-N.B.A. experience would be better for the players and better for basketball, pro and college....
docs.lead_paragraph: A former N.B.A. player, now a league executive, asserts that two years of pre-N.B.A. experience would be better for the players and better for basketball, pro and college.
docs.abstract: Box Seats column by NBA basketball executive Kiki Vandeweghe makes case for extending NBA's waiting period to two years after high school, saying two years of pre-NBA experience would be beneficial to players, as well as the game; says that players would be more mature, drafts would be better and college game would be healthier.

headline.main: N.B.A. Eligibility Rule Is Good for the Game
headline.print_headline: N.B.A. Eligibility Rule Is Good for the Game
